What an interesting story they've spun around Noxus. It seems LeBlanc, Vladimir, Mordekaiser, Veigar, Ryze and the Darkin are all related.

I know, right?

I think this might be a European thing. I got here and was soundly mocked for my "inability" to pronounce Veigar, Braum, and Warwick.
yeah i guess. i've noticed american content creators pronounce it different but even then it was "vegar" most of the time.
Maura... from the vladimir short, is that our colorful mage ??
Doubtful, the story implies he absorbed her to extend his immortality.

I don't see how that's implied. 

He was immortal the moment his former master's blood touched his lips, no? 

He shouldn't need to consume lives to extend his life.

Umm this is kind of an old post but, he didn't become immortal in the same way as an ascended, he learned blood magic, in game this translates to stealing his opponents HP, so it would make sense if lore followed suit.

Furthermore his lore says he received the power to renew his flesh from the Darkin, meaning he got the capabilities, it never said it's what made him immortal.

And his lore also states he demanded sacrifices, implying he needs them, and furthermore the Darkin's magic let's them steal flesh from others to build themselves new bodies.

Fair enough. 

There is still the probability he doesn't need to absorb her, he could very easily pick off some random nobody in a dark alley if he really needed to renew his flesh.

The connection between Maura as a painter and the new colourful mage shown here: https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2018/08/champion-roadmap-august-2018/ is what led me to believe she didn't get absorb.

There's no real connection there, it's a hidden colorful mage, Maura wasn't hidden, she is an artist.

And Vladimir is all about poetry, who best to be his next life extender than the one who has chronicled his current life for him?

Of course we won't know for sure until the mage is revealed so I guess just wait until then.

Maybe she's hidden like : Hidden in Vladimir's lair... :C

Or maybe it's just a Chameleon pure-blood Vastaya mage

Good question, I had the same thought.

Feels a bit like Castlevania aye? Woman walks into the lair of Dracula but doesn't die.

Well Maura is a painter (who obviously have a palette of colours to paint from) and the upcoming champ is a **colourful** mage. Connecting the dots, it seems like a plausible guess I'd say.
I really like how Vladmir lost track of himself because he lived too long. It sort of gives his personality as a old blood mage rather than a vampire monster.
